[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/common/logging.rs] [Field: error] [Error Context Loss] Does logging only the Error type without full backtrace or context prevent security teams from determining if errors resulted from Byzantine attacks versus benign failures? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/common/logging.rs] [Field: peer] [Validator Identity Exposure] Does logging PeerNetworkId (line 18) with display formatting expose validator network addresses or identities that could enable DDoS attacks or targeted censorship of specific validators? [File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/common/logging.rs] [Field: peer] [Network Topology Leak] Can accumulated peer logs from LogSchema reveal the full consensus network topology, including observer-to-validator connections, enabling sophisticated eclipse or network partition attacks? [File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/common/logging.rs] [Field: request_id] [Request Correlation Attack] Can attackers manipulate or predict request_id values (line 19) to correlate logged events across different validators, enabling them to fingerprint validator behaviors and plan targeted attacks? [File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/common/logging.rs] [Field: request_id] [Integer Overflow] Does the u64 request_id field properly handle overflow scenarios, or could wrapping after 2^64 requests cause log correlation failures that hide long-running attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/common/logging.rs] [Field: request_type] [Request Type Spoofing] Does the system validate request_type strings (line 20), or can malicious peers send crafted requests with fake types that appear benign in logs while executing attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/common/logging.rs] [Struct: LogSchema] [Missing Authentication Context] Does LogSchema lack fields for authentication context (like signature verification results or validator authority checks), making it impossible to audit unauthorized access attempts through logs? [File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/common/logging.rs] [Struct: LogSchema] [Missing Timing Information] Without timestamp fields in LogSchema, can attackers exploit timing attacks or race conditions that would be undetectable in logs because temporal ordering is ambiguous? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/common/logging.rs] [Enum: LogEvent] [Clone Semantics] Can the Clone + Copy semantics on LogEvent (line 48) cause race conditions where copied event values don't reflect the actual event state at logging time, hiding consensus anomalies? (Low)
